name: Overlooked or Forgotten Writers Online Trivia | People | 10 Questions

questions.text: This author is best known for 'The Way of the World'
questions.explanation:
William Congreve.

	A comedy of the time (1700)

questions.text: This author wrote many historical works, including a biography of Schiller?
This author is best known for his biography of Dr. Johnson.
questions.explanation:
James Boswell.

	Perhaps he's ONLY known for his bio of Johnson.

questions.text: One of this writer's key works was 'The Sorrows of Young Werther'
questions.explanation:
Johann Goethe.

	Mann did 'Death in {Venice';} Hesse did 'Steppenwolf' and 'Siddhartha'.

questions.text: This author is primarily known for his short stories, including 'Ficciones'.
questions.explanation:
Jorge Luis Borges.

	Modern 20th century writer (South America) with unusual style.

questions.text: This writer is best known for 'The Red and the Black' and 'The Charterhouse of Parma'
This author is perhaps most well-known for 'The Counterfeiters'
questions.explanation:
Andre Gide.

	Camus did 'The Stranger'; Flaubert did 'Madame Bovary'

questions.text: This Pulitzer Prize winning author wrote "A Death in the Family"?
questions.explanation:
James Agee.

	His most famous work.

questions.text: This author, known in part for his plays, also wrote 'The Bridge of San Luis Rey'.
This Nobel Prize winner is best known for 'The Tin Drum'.
questions.explanation:
Gunter Grass.

	Remarque wrote the classic 'All Quiet on The Western Front'.
